data: If you follow these instructions, do you return to the starting point? Always face forward. Take 9 steps left. Take 10 steps forward. Take 9 steps right. Take 10 steps backward. Options: - Yes - No Let’ s think step by step.

Whenever you face forward, you go forward. Whenever you look left or right, you look straight. The order in which you take your steps is as follows: Take 10 steps forward. Take 10 steps forward. Take 9 steps right. Take 10 steps backward. So, the answer is No.
If you follow these instructions, do you return to the starting point? Take 4 steps. Turn around. Take 4 steps. Turn around. Turn right. Options: - Yes - No Let’ s think step by step.
If you repeat this last time, the startpoint is the first set of 4 steps. There is no way to go back to the setting point as you do it twice. Thus, the answer is no.
If you follow these instructions, do you return to the starting point? Take 6 steps. Take 4 steps. Turn around. Take 10 steps. Options: - Yes - No Let’ s think step by step.

Since you are going back 6 steps, you will need to take 6 steps to get back to the starting point. Since you are going back 4 steps, you will need to take 4 steps to get back to the starting point. So, the answer is No.

Take 5 steps on your way back to the starting point. Thus, the answer is Yes.

After you take around three steps, you return to the starting point. So, the answer is Yes.

It is impossible to turn around and then turn around. The instructions require that you are in two directions. So, the answer is no.

The directions are all taken to always face forward so we would always take 1 step left. So, the answer is Yes.

The instructions give you a total of 9 steps plus 3 steps. If you want to turn around and take 2 steps, there are 2 steps. A total of 9 steps + 2 steps = 17 steps. If you want to take 7 steps, there are 7 steps. So, the answer is No.

At the opposite end of the first step, takes first step backward. One step backward does not return you to the starting point. So, the answer is No.

If you always face forward, there is no need to face backward. If you face backward, you are likely traveling at a speed of 12 mile an hour. The correct answer: Yes.

The sequence always returns you to the point where you started. So, the answer is no.

There is no way to return to the starting point. Any direction other than forward can lead you to the starting point. If one takes four steps left one takes five. To take four steps right one takes two. So, the answer is no.

First, face right so you have plenty of room to walk. Secondly, take 3 steps right and take 1 step backward. Thirdly, take 3 steps right and make the same length for you as you would for the first two ways. Fourthly, take 3 steps right and make the same length as you would for the first two ways. So, the answer is no.

The first 10 steps could only have come from facing forward. The last 6 steps could not have been coming from rearward. The starting point of an obstacle course is always backward. So, the answer is No.

The first step takes you to the starting point. The subsequent steps take you back an extra step. Turn around and turn around again. So, the answer is yes.

Once you take 9 steps forward the direction you were facing forward is reversed. When facing forward, you always take 6 steps to the left. You can still take 7 steps to the right, but you do not turn your face to the opposite direction and take 7 steps backward. If you face backward, you take 2 steps left, so you take 2 steps left. If you face left, you take 6 steps to the left, so you take 6 steps left. If you face right, you take 4 steps to the left, so you take 4 steps right. If you face left, you take 2 steps right. If you face right, you take 5 steps to the left. If you face left, you take 2 steps left. So, the answer is no.

The starting point means the same as the destination point. If it takes 10 steps to turn around, you could take 20 steps to turn around. The return route, if completed, will mean you'll be in the starting point. So, the answer is Yes.
